jobDescription.aboutCompany: About TradeLyncs: TradeLyncs is a leading global trade finance platform that leverages cutting-edge technology to streamline cross-border transactions. Our platform empowers businesses of all sizes to navigate the complexities of international trade with ease and efficiency.
jobDescription.roleOverview: Role Overview: We are seeking a talented and experienced Web Developer to join our dynamic team. The Web Developer will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining TradeLyncs' web-based applications and interfaces. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in web development, proficiency in front-end and back-end technologies, and a passion for creating innovative digital solutions.
jobDescription.keyResponsibilities:
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements, design user interfaces, and develop responsive web applications.
  • Write clean, efficient, and well-documented code using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and other relevant programming languages and frameworks.
  • Implement and maintain scalable and secure web architectures, ensuring optimal performance and reliability.
  • Conduct thorough testing and debugging of web applications to identify and resolve issues promptly.
  • Stay up-to-date with emerging technologies and best practices in web development, integrating new features and enhancements as needed.
  • Work closely with UX/UI designers to ensure a seamless and intuitive user experience across all web platforms.
  • Provide technical support and guidance to internal stakeholders, assisting with troubleshooting and resolving technical issues.
jobDescription.qualifications:
• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.
  • Minimum of 3 years of professional experience in web development.
  • Proficiency in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and front-end frameworks such as React, Angular, or Vue.js.
  • Experience with back-end technologies such as Node.js, Express, Django, or Ruby on Rails.
  • Solid understanding of web development best practices, responsive design principles, and accessibility standards.
  • Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
  • Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.
  • Experience with version control systems (e.g., Git) and agile development methodologies is a plus.
jobDescription.benefits:
• Competitive salary and performance-based incentives.
  • Comprehensive health, dental, and vision insurance plans.
  • Retirement savings plan.
  • Paid vacation, holidays, and sick leave.
  • Professional development opportunities and ongoing training programs.
  • Collaborative and inclusive work environment with opportunities for growth and advancement.
jobDescription.description: How to Apply: If you are passionate about web development and eager to contribute to the success of a leading fintech company, we invite you to apply by submitting your resume and a cover letter highlighting your relevant experience and achievements in web development. Please include links to any portfolio or projects you have worked on.

jobDescription.keyResponsibilities:

  • Strong understanding of front-end development technologies and frameworks (e.g., HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Angular/React).

jobDescription.benefits:
• Competitive salary and performance-based incentives.

  • Opportunities for career growth and advancement.
  • Collaborative and inclusive work culture.

  • Professional development opportunities and training programs.
jobDescription.description: How to Apply:: If you are passionate about Java development and eager to join a leading technology company at the forefront of global trade innovation, we invite you to apply by submitting your resume and a cover letter detailing your relevant experience and why you are the ideal candidate for the role of Full Stack Java Developer at TradeLyncs. We look forward to reviewing your application!

jobDescription.aboutCompany: About TradeLyncs:TradeLyncs is a leading global trade finance platform leveraging cutting-edge technology to facilitate seamless and secure cross-border transactions. Our mission is to empower businesses of all sizes to navigate the complexities of international trade with confidence and efficiency.
jobDescription.roleOverview: Role Overview: We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Head of Credit to join our dynamic team. The Head of Credit will play a pivotal role in shaping and implementing credit risk management strategies, ensuring the stability and growth of our trade finance operations. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record in credit risk assessment, portfolio management, and team leadership.
jobDescription.keyResponsibilities:
• Develop and implement credit risk policies and procedures to mitigate potential risks and optimize credit decision-making processes.
  • Lead the credit underwriting process, including assessing creditworthiness, analyzing financial statements, and evaluating collateral.
  • Monitor and manage credit exposures, delinquencies, and defaults, proactively identifying and addressing emerging risks.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including sales, operations, and compliance, to optimize credit risk management practices.
  • Provide strategic guidance and mentorship to the credit team, fostering a culture of continuous learning and professional development.
  • Stay abreast of industry trends, regulatory developments, and best practices in credit risk management, incorporating relevant insights into TradeLyncs' credit policies and procedures.
  • Drive innovation and process improvements to enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of credit risk management operations.
jobDescription.qualifications:
• Bachelor's degree in Finance, Economics, or a related field; Master's degree preferred.
  • Minimum of 7 years of experience in credit risk management within the trade finance or banking industry.
  • Strong understanding of credit risk assessment methodologies, financial analysis, and regulatory requirements.
  • Proven leadership skills with the ability to motivate and inspire cross-functional teams.
  • Excellent communication, interpersonal, and problem-solving skills.
  • Proficiency in credit risk management software and analytics tools.
  • Demonstrated ability to thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.
jobDescription.benefits:
• Competitive salary and performance-based incentives.
  • Comprehensive health, dental, and vision insurance plans.
  • Retirement savings plan with employer matching.
  • Flexible work schedule and remote work options.
  • Professional development opportunities and ongoing training programs.
  • Dynamic and inclusive company culture with opportunities for growth and advancement.
jobDescription.description: How to Apply: If you are passionate about driving innovation in trade finance and possess the skills and experience to excel in this role, we invite you to apply by submitting your resume and cover letter detailing your relevant qualifications and achievements.
